00039 
00047 AqSeries::AqSeries(const Path & filename){
00048 
00049   if (filename.empty()) // empty list
00050     return;
00051 
00052   FILE* input_list = fopen(filename.c_str(), "r");
00053   if ( ! input_list )
00054     throw_error (modname, "Could not open input data file"
00055                                  " \"" + filename + "\" for reading.");
00056   const int MAXSTRING = FILENAME_MAX + 1 + 16 + 1;
00057   char curin[MAXSTRING];
00058   int bgindex = nobg;
00059   string fdir=filename.dir(), curstring;
00060   
00061   while ( fgets (curin, MAXSTRING, input_list) ) {
00062 
00063     curstring = string(curin);
00064         if ( ! curstring.empty() && *(curstring.end()-1) == '\n')
00065       curstring.erase(curstring.end()-1);
00066 
00067         if ( curstring.find_first_not_of(" \t") != string::npos ) {
00068           if ( isbgstring(curstring) ) {
00069                 curstring = bgname(curstring);
00070                 if ( curstring.empty() ) {
00071                   bgindex = nobg;
00072                 } else {
00073             // Windows version is likely to fail here. See cdpath in common.cpp
00074                   bgs.push_back( cdpath(fdir, curstring) );
00075                   bgindex = bgs.size()-1 ;
00076                 }
00077       } else if ( isdcstring(curstring) ) {
00078         curstring = dcname(curstring);
00079                 if ( ! curstring.empty() )
00080                   dcs.push_back( cdpath(fdir, curstring) );
00081       } else if ( iscomment(curstring) ) {
00082         // Do nothing
00083           } else {
00084                 fgs.push_back( fgelement( cdpath(fdir, curstring), bgindex ) );
00085           }
00086         }
00087 
00088   }
00089 
00090   fclose(input_list);
00091 
00092   if ( ! thetas() )
00093         throw_error (modname, "Empty input data file '" + filename + "'.");
00094 
00095   sh = ImageSizes(fg(0));
00096 
00097 }

00107 bool
00108 AqSeries::isbgstring(const string & str) const {
00109   return ! str.compare(0, BGPREFIX.length(), BGPREFIX);
00110 }
00111 
00118 bool
00119 AqSeries::isdcstring(const string & str) const {
00120   return ! str.compare(0, DCPREFIX.length(), DCPREFIX);
00121 }
00122 
00129 bool
00130 AqSeries::iscomment(const string & str) const {
00131   return str.empty() || ! str.compare(0, 1, "#");
00132 }

00141 Path
00142 AqSeries::bgname(const string & str) const {
00143   return isbgstring(str) ? str.substr( BGPREFIX.length() ) : string("") ;
00144 }
00145 
00152 Path
00153 AqSeries::dcname(const string & str) const {
00154   return isdcstring(str) ? str.substr( DCPREFIX.length() ) : string("") ;
00155 }

00164 int
00165 AqSeries::index(int idx) const  {
00166   if ( idx >= thetas() )
00167         throw_error (modname, "Bad index " + toString(idx) +
00168                                  " is outside the list of size (" + toString(thetas()) + ")");
00169   return idx;
00170 }
00171 
00178 const Path
00179 AqSeries::fg(int idx) const {
00180   return fgs[index(idx)].first;
00181 }
00182 
00183 
00191 const Path
00192 AqSeries::bg(int idx) const {
00193   index(idx);
00194   return ( fgs[idx].second == nobg ) ? Path() : bgs[ fgs[idx].second ];
00195 }

00197 
00204 void
00205 AqSeries::darkCurrent(Map & dcc, const std::vector<int> & sliceV) const {
00206 
00207   Shape dsh = sliceV.size() ? Shape(sliceV.size(), sh(1)) : sh ;
00208   dcc.resize(dsh);
00209   dcc=0.0;
00210 
00211   for (int icur=0 ; icur < dcs.size() ; icur++) {
00212     Map dct(sh);
00213     ReadImageLine(dcs[icur], dct, sliceV, sh);
00214     dcc += dct;
00215   }
00216   if (dcs.size())
00217     dcc /= dcs.size();
00218 }
00219 
00220 
00228 void AqSeries::projection(int idx, Map & proj, const std::vector<int> & sliceV)  const {
00229 
00230   index(idx);
00231   static vector<int> slices;
00232   static Shape dsh;
00233   static Map dcc, bgc;
00234   static string bgname;
00235 
00236   if ( slices != sliceV ) {
00237     if ( sliceV.back() >= sh(0) )
00238       throw_error(modname, "The maximum slice in the requested list of slices"
00239                   " (" + toString(sliceV.back()+1) + ") is outside the image height"
00240                   " (" + toString(sh(0)) + ").");
00241     slices=sliceV;
00242     dsh = sliceV.size() ? Shape(sliceV.size(), sh(1)) : sh ;
00243     bgc.resize(dsh);
00244     bgc = 1.0;
00245     darkCurrent(dcc, slices);
00246     bgname = "";
00247   }
00248 
00249   if ( bg(idx) != bgname ) {
00250     bgname = bg(idx);
00251     if (bgname.empty())
00252       bgc = 1.0;
00253     else
00254       ReadImageLine(bgname, bgc, sliceV, sh);
00255   }
00256 
00257   Map fgc(sh);
00258   ReadImageLine(fg(idx), fgc, sliceV, sh);
00259 
00260   flatfield(proj, fgc, bgc, dcc);
00261 
00262   return;
00263 
00264 }
00265 
00266 const std::string AqSeries::modname  = "acquisition series";
00267 const std::string AqSeries::BGPREFIX = "#BACKGROUND# ";
00268 const std::string AqSeries::DCPREFIX = "#DARKCURRENT# ";
00269 const std::string AqSeries::Desc =
00270   "Text file which describes the stack of input images: foregrounds and (optionally)"
00271   " background(s). The strings in the file can be one of the following forms:\n"
00272   "    " + AqSeries::BGPREFIX + "<background filename>\n"
00273   "The string prefixed with the \"" + AqSeries::BGPREFIX + "\" gives the name of the"
00274   " background file right after the prefix. This background file contains the background"
00275   " contrast for all foregrounds below it until the next background string is met."
00276   " No background removal is performed for all foregrounds given in the strings"
00277   " above the first background. If the string starting with the prefix does not"
00278   " contain any background name then all following foregrounds are considered as"
00279   " is ( i.e. no background removal is performed).\n"
00280   "    " + AqSeries::DCPREFIX + "<dark current filename>\n"
00281   "The string prefixed with the \"" + AqSeries::DCPREFIX + "\" gives the name of"
00282   " the dark current file right after the prefix. If more than one DC file is"
00283   " given, then the average of all are used.\n"
00284   "    <foreground filename>\n"
00285   "The foreground string gives the name of the actual contrast of the sample.\n"
00286   "    # <comment>\n"
00287   "The string starting with '#' sign, is treated as a comment.\n"
00288   "    <empty string>\n"
00289   "Empty strings can be used for grouping and have no influence.";
00290

00295 
00296 const string MaskDesc =
00297   "Used when there is a need to describe a stack of output files. In this case"
00298   " the special character represents the number of the output file in the stack."
00299   " The result mask is a string which forms the names of the processed slices."
00300   " The mask should (but not must) contain the '@' character which denotes the"
00301   " position where the slice number will be inserted:\n"
00302   "    If there is no '@' in the mask, it is inserted together with the '-'"
00303   " prefix right before the file extension (if any) or at the end of the mask"
00304   " (if no extension).\n"
00305   "    If there are more than one '@' character in the mask, only the last of"
00306   " them is replaced by the slice number.\n"
00307   "For example the mask\n"
00308   "    ../path/to/@/result/rec-@-@@.png\n"
00309   "produces file names similar to this (for the 13th slice):\n"
00310   "    ../path/to/@/result/rec-@-@013.png\n"
00311   "Note that the path(s) to the files must exist: the program will not create"
00312   " any directory.";
00313 
00314 string
00315 mask2format(const string & mask, int maxslice){
00316   string format(mask);
00317   // replace all '%' by "%%"
00318   string::size_type pos = format.find('%');
00319   while ( pos != string::npos ) {
00320         format.insert(pos, "%");
00321         pos = format.find('%', pos+2);
00322   }
00323   //replace last '@' with the format expression.
00324   format.replace( format.rfind('@'), 1,
00325                                   "%0" + toString( toString(maxslice).length() ) + "u");
00326   return format;
00327 }

00332 
00333 const string SliceOptionDesc=
00334   "The string describing the slices in the image stack which are to be"
00335   " processed. Must be a string consisting only of numbers, commas ','"
00336   " minus signs '-' and the character 'n'. First the string is divided"
00337   " into the substrings separated by comas and each substring is"
00338   " processed on it's own:\n"
00339   "    The string consisting only of numbers is read as the integer and"
00340   " added to the list of the reconstructed slices.\n"
00341   "    The string with the minus sign surrounded by the numbers adds all"
00342   " slices in the range into the list.\n"
00343   "    If the string starts with the minus then the range start is"
00344   " assumed to be 1.\n"
00345   "    If minus is the last character in the string then the range"
00346   " finishes at the maximum slice number.\n"
00347   "    If the string has negation prefix 'n' then the slice(s) are"
00348   " excluded from the previously formed list.\n"
00349   "    If all substrings have 'n' prefix or the first substring contains"
00350   " only it, then the meaning of the whole string is \"all except ...\".\n"
00351   "    Two and more negations are interpreted as a single one.\n"
00352   "    If no slice string is given then all slices are reconstructed.\n"
00353   "For example the following string:\n"
00354   "    9,-4,6,20-400,n3,500-440,n450-470,800-,n920-910,915\n"
00355   "requests processing of the slices with numbers 1, 2, 4, 6, 9, 20 to 400,"
00356   " 440 to 449, 471 to 500, 800 to 909, 915 and 921 to the end.";
00357 
00358 
00369 static inline vector<int> &
00370 rmadd(vector<int> & arr, int numb, bool negate){
00371   if (negate)
00372         arr.erase( remove( arr.begin(), arr.end(), numb ), arr.end() );
00373   else
00374         arr.push_back(numb);
00375   return arr;
00376 }
00377 
00384 static inline int str2n(const string & str){
00385   long idx = strtol ( str.c_str() , 0, 0);
00386   if ( ! idx )
00387         warn("string to int", "Zero slice. Must be positive. Set to 1.");
00388   return idx ? idx-1 : 1;
00389 }
00390 
00391 vector<int>
00392 slice_str2vec(const string & sliceS, int hight){
00393 
00394   const char negatec = 'n';
00395   const string permitted_chars = string("0123456789,-") + negatec ;
00396 
00397   vector<int> sliceV; // the array to be returned as the result.
00398  
00399   // empty string
00400   if ( sliceS.empty() ) {
00401         for (int slice = 0 ; slice < hight ; slice++)
00402           sliceV.push_back(slice);
00403         return sliceV;
00404   }
00405 
00406 
00407   // construct the vector of substrings and checks for the global negation.
00408   vector<string> subSV;
00409   bool negateall = true; // turns to false if an unnegated substring found.
00410   string::size_type startidx=0, endidx;
00411   do{
00412 
00413         // extract substring
00414         endidx = sliceS.find(',', startidx);
00415         string subS = sliceS.substr(startidx, ( endidx == string::npos ?
00416                                                                                         sliceS.length() :
00417                                                                                         endidx-startidx) );
00418         startidx=endidx+1;
00419 
00420         // checks for the non permitted characters
00421         if ( subS.find_first_not_of(permitted_chars) != string::npos ) {
00422           warn("slice string", "Substring \""+ subS +"\" in the "
00423                    " string describing set of slices to be reconstructed:\n"
00424                    + sliceS +"\n"
00425                    "has character(s) not from the permitted set"
00426                    " \""+ permitted_chars +"\". Skipping the substring.");
00427           subS.erase();
00428         }
00429 
00430         // check it and add to the vector of substrings.
00431         if ( ! subS.empty() ) {
00432 
00433           const string initS = subS;
00434 
00435           // modifies in regards to the negatec
00436           string::size_type lastneg = subS.rfind(negatec);
00437           if ( lastneg != string::npos ) {
00438                 if ( lastneg != 0 ) {
00439                   warn("slice string", "Suspicious substring \""+ initS +"\" in the"
00440                            " string describing set of slices to be reconstructed:\n"
00441                            + sliceS +"\n"
00442                            "it has '" + negatec + "' character not in the first position."
00443                            " Moving it to the begining. Is it what you meant?");
00444                   // moves all negatec's to the beginning and erases it's duplicates.
00445                   subS.erase
00446                         ( subS.begin(),
00447                           stable_partition( subS.begin(), subS.end(),
00448                                                                 bind2nd(equal_to<char>(),negatec) ) - 1 );
00449                 }
00450           } else {
00451                 negateall = false;
00452           }
00453 
00454           // modifies in regards to '-'
00455           if ( count(subS.begin(), subS.end(), '-') > 1 ) {
00456                 warn("slice string", "Substring \""+ initS +"\" in the "
00457                          " string describing set of slices to be reconstructed:\n"
00458                          + sliceS +"\n"
00459                          "has more than one minus sign '-'. Everything between first"
00460                          " and last minuses is ignored. Is it what you meant?");
00461                 subS = subS.substr(0,subS.find('-')) + subS.substr(subS.rfind('-') );
00462           }
00463           // make sure minus is surrounded by numbers.
00464           if ( subS[0] == '-' )
00465                 subS = "1" + subS;
00466           if ( subS.substr(0,2) == "n-" )
00467                 subS.insert(1,"1");
00468           if ( subS[subS.length()-1] == '-' )
00469                 subS = subS + toString(hight);
00470 
00471           subSV.push_back(subS);
00472 
00473         }
00474 
00475   } while ( string::npos != endidx );
00476 
00477 
00478   // Check for global negation.
00479   if ( negateall |= ( subSV[0] == string(1,negatec) ) )
00480         for ( int icur = 0 ; icur < hight ; icur++)
00481           sliceV.push_back(icur);
00482   subSV.erase( remove( subSV.begin(), subSV.end(), string(1,negatec) ),
00483                            subSV.end() ); // no "negate" strings
00484 
00485   // adds/removes substrings into the array of slices
00486   vector<string>::iterator subSVi = subSV.begin();
00487   const vector<string>::iterator subSVe=subSV.end();
00488 
00489 
00490   while ( subSVi != subSVe ) {
00491 
00492         bool negatethis = (*subSVi)[0]==negatec;
00493         if (negatethis) (*subSVi).erase(0,1);
00494         negatethis |= negateall;
00495 
00496         string::size_type minuspos = (*subSVi).find('-');
00497         if ( minuspos != string::npos ) {
00498           int
00499                 rangeB = str2n( (*subSVi).substr(0,minuspos) ),
00500                 rangeE = str2n( (*subSVi).substr(minuspos+1) );
00501           if ( rangeB > rangeE ) swap(rangeB,rangeE);
00502           if ( rangeB == rangeE )
00503                 warn("slice string", "One of the substrings with ranges"
00504                          " in the string describing set of slices to be reconstructed:\n"
00505                          + sliceS +"\n"
00506                          "has equal ends of the ranges. Is it what you meant?");
00507           for (int curS = rangeB ; curS <= rangeE ; curS++ )
00508                 rmadd(sliceV, curS, negatethis);
00509         } else {
00510           rmadd(sliceV, str2n( *subSVi ), negatethis );
00511         }
00512 
00513         subSVi++;
00514 
00515   }
00516 
00517   // sort and remove duplicates, too large numbers
00518   sort(sliceV.begin(), sliceV.end());
00519   sliceV.erase( unique( sliceV.begin(), sliceV.end() ), sliceV.end() );
00520   if ( sliceV.back() > hight )
00521         warn("slice string",
00522                  "The string describing set of slices to be reconstructed:\n"
00523                  + sliceS +"\n"
00524                  "Includes slices more than the height of the input image"
00525                  " (" + toString(hight) + "). These slices are ignored." );
00526   sliceV.erase( find_if( sliceV.begin(), sliceV.end(),
00527                                                  bind2nd( greater<int>(), hight ) ),
00528                                 sliceV.end() );
00529 
00530   // last check
00531   if ( sliceV.empty() )
00532         warn("slice string",
00533                  "The string describing set of slices to be reconstructed:\n"
00534                  + sliceS +"\n"
00535                  "leads to the empty range of slices." );
00536 
00537   return sliceV;
00538 
00539 }

00555 const string SinoS::modname = "sinogram array";
00556 
00557 #ifdef _WIN32
00558 #include "experiment.win32.cpp"
00559 #else
00560 #include <sys/mman.h>
00561 #endif
00562 
00563 #include <string.h>
00564 
00565 
00572 inline static int
00573 tempfile(const off_t size){
00574 
00575   const char * tmpenv =  "TMPDIR";
00576   const string tempdesc =  "You can control the path to the temporary file via"
00577         " the environment variable \"" + (string) tmpenv + "\".";
00578   const char * TMPDIR = getenv (tmpenv);
00579   if ( ! TMPDIR ) TMPDIR = "./" ;
00580   if ( strlen(TMPDIR) >= 248 ) { // little under the maximum length (256)
00581         warn("temp file", (string)
00582                  "The environment variable \"" + tmpenv + "\" is too long:\n"
00583                  + TMPDIR + "\n"
00584                  "Switching to the default one \"./\". " + tempdesc);
00585         TMPDIR = "./";
00586   }
00587   char tmpfilename[256]; // maximum file name length
00588   strcpy(tmpfilename, TMPDIR);
00589   if ( tmpfilename[ strlen(tmpfilename)-1 ] != '/' )
00590         strcpy(tmpfilename+strlen(tmpfilename), "/");
00591   strcpy(tmpfilename+strlen(tmpfilename), "XXXXXX");
00592 
00593   int filedesc = mkstemp(tmpfilename);
00594   if ( filedesc < 0 )
00595         throw_error("temp file", "Could not open temporary file"
00596                                 " \"" + string(tmpfilename) + "\". " + tempdesc);
00597   if ( unlink(tmpfilename) < 0 )
00598         warn("temp file", "Could not unlink temporary file"
00599                  " \"" + string(tmpfilename) + "\". Don't forget"
00600                  " to delete it after the program has finished.");
00601   if ( lseek(filedesc, size, SEEK_SET) != size ||
00602            write(filedesc, "END", 3) != 3 ) {
00603         // Should I pad the holes ???
00604         close (filedesc);
00605         throw_error("temp file", "Could not set size of the  temporary file"
00606                     " \"" + string(tmpfilename) + "\". You need " + toString((long unsigned)size) +
00607                 "bytes on the hard disk. " + tempdesc);
00608   }
00609 
00610   return filedesc;
00611 
00612 }
00613 
00620 SinoS::SinoS(const Experiment & exp, const vector<int> & sliceV, bool _verb)
00621   : verb(_verb) {
00622 
00623   if ( ! exp.thetas() )
00624         throw_error(modname, "Empty experiment.");
00625 
00626   slcs = sliceV.size() ? sliceV.size() : exp.slices();
00627   thts = exp.thetas();
00628   pxls = exp.pixels();
00629 
00630   if ( sliceV.back() >= exp.slices() )
00631         throw_error(modname, "The maximum slice in the requested list of slices"
00632                                 " (" + toString(sliceV.back()+1) + ") is outside the image height"
00633                                 " (" + toString(exp.slices()) + ").");
00634   allpix = long(thts) * long(slcs) *long(pxls);
00635 
00636   // Create this huge array of input data
00637   mapfile = 0;
00638   blitz::TinyVector<long, 3> datashp(thts, slcs, pxls);
00639   try { data.resize(datashp); }
00640   catch(bad_alloc err) {
00641         warn (modname, "Failed to allocate memory."
00642                   " Trying to play with the memory mapped to file.");
00643         mapfile = tempfile( allpix*sizeof(float) );
00644         float * datap = (float*)
00645           mmap( 0, allpix*sizeof(float),
00646                         PROT_WRITE|PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, mapfile, 0);
00647         data.reference( Volume(datap, datashp, blitz::neverDeleteData) );
00648   }
00649 
00650 
00651   // Read images to the array.
00652   Map proj(Shape(slcs,pxls));
00653   ProgressBar bar(verb, "reading projections", thts);
00654   for ( int curproj = 0 ; curproj < thts ; curproj++){
00655     exp.projection(curproj, proj, sliceV);
00656         data(curproj, blitz::Range::all(), blitz::Range::all()) = proj;
00657         bar.update();
00658   }
00659 
00660 }
00661 
00662 
00663 SinoS::~SinoS(){
00664   if (mapfile) {
00665         munmap(data.data(), allpix*sizeof(float) );
00666         close(mapfile);
00667   } else {
00668         data.free();
00669   }
00670 }
00671 
00677 void
00678 SinoS::sino(int idx, Map & storage) const {
00679   index(idx);
00680   storage.resize(thts, pxls);
00681   storage = data
00682         (blitz::Range::all(), idx, blitz::Range::all()).copy();
00683 }

00692 int
00693 SinoS::index(int idx) const  {
00694   if ( idx<0 || idx >= slcs )
00695         throw_error (modname, "Bad index " + toString(idx) +
00696                                  " is outside the slices (" + toString(slcs) + ")");
00697   return idx;
00698 }

00730 
00735 Dcenter::Dcenter(const string & centerdesc) {
00736   acof = 0.0;
00737   bcof = 0.0;
00738 
00739   const char *start = centerdesc.c_str();
00740   char *tail;
00741   bcof = strtod (start, &tail);
00742   if (tail == start)
00743         throw_error("dcenter", "String \""+ centerdesc +"\""
00744                                 " could not be decomposed to any float number.");
00745   if ( *tail ) {
00746         if ( ! *(start=tail+1) ) {
00747           warn("dcenter",
00748                    "Second part of the string \""+ centerdesc +"\" is empty.");
00749           return;
00750         }
00751         acof = strtod (start, &tail);
00752         if (tail == start)
00753           throw_error("dcenter", "Second part of the string \""+ centerdesc +"\""
00754                                   " : \"" + start + "\" could not be decomposed to any"
00755                                   " float number.");
00756   }
00757   if ( *tail )
00758         warn("dcenter",
00759                  "String \""+ centerdesc +"\", after decomposed into float(s)"
00760                  " has remaining tail \""+tail+"\".");
00761 
00762 };
00763 
00764 
00770 Dcenter::Dcenter(float _b, float _a)
00771   : acof(_a), bcof(_b) { }
00772 
00779 float
00780 Dcenter::operator()(int slice) const {
00781   return bcof + acof*slice ;
00782 }
00783 
00784 
00785 const string DcenterOptionDesc=
00786   "Deviation of the rotation axis from the center of the sinogram.\n"
00787   "Allows you to erase some minor artifacts in the reconstructed image"
00788   " which come from the inaccurate rotation position. The two float"
00789   " values are the coefficient \"bconf\" and \"aconf\" respectively for the"
00790   " calculation of the deviation of the rotation center as\n"
00791   "    center = bconf + aconf * slice\n"
00792   "with the \"slice\" being the index in the projection image. If only"
00793   " first of two floats is given then aconf=0.0 (i.e. the rotation axis"
00794   " is strictly vertical).\n"
00795   "Note: in most real CT or TS experiments the rotation center of the sample"
00796   " is not exactly in the center of the recoded projection. Moreover,"
00797   " the rotation axis may be inclined from the vertical orientation."
00798   " If the inclination of the rotation axis is noticeable for your desired"
00799   " spatial resolution then you should rotate the images before the actual"
00800   " reconstruction. You can do it in the batch using \"mogrify\" command"
00801   " from the ImageMagick package with the -rotate option.";
00802 
00803 
00804 string
00805 type_desc (Dcenter*){
00806   return "FLOAT[:FLOAT]";
00807 }
00808 
00809 bool
00810 _conversion (Dcenter* _val, const string & in) {
00811   *_val=Dcenter(in);
00812   return true;
00813 }
